title: Password Reset Does Not Confirm the Existence of an Email Address
vulnerability_information:
issue:
1.click forget password as driver or rider [https://login.uber.com/login]
2.input an email which not signed up! 
3. press reset password. 
there will be 'We've sent you an email with a link to reset your password.' message. 

because it can not verify email is signed up or not! 

I'd tried with my personal email. I got the message in webpage but did not get any further email from Uber. 
is that another bug?

activities.message:
Hello, thanks for your report. 

I'm a little confused by what you're reporting here. Can you please rephrase your report? Are you say that you have an Uber account but you're not receiving a password reset email?  Or are you reporting that the forgot password request will always return with the message, `"We've sent you an email with a link to reset your password."`, regardless of what email address is entered? Any additional images, or a video, that demonstrates the issue would also help us to evaluate this report. 

Thank and good luck in your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Thanks for the follow up but this is actually a security measure to help mitigate email enumeration. By sending the same message after an email address has been entered, an attacker would not be able to enumerate email addresses at this endpoint. Thus, we don't intend to make any changes in regard to this report. 

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.
